page.title: 06 INGESTRE HALL:THE HISTORY
page.content: Ingestre Hall was mentioned in the original Domesday Survey in 1086 as a Norman Manor House.However today,there is little remaining of the original building. In 1613 the building was pulled down by Sir Walter Chetwynd and the present Jacobean rose-brick manor was erected in its place. In later years the architect John Nash made alterations to the Jacobean South Front.However,a fire in 1882 damaged the building and it took 3 years to re -build it.The architect,Birch,tried to re-produce the original building using the old bricks and only changed the entrance at the request of the twentieth Earl of Shrewsbury. Recently,restoration work to the roof and stonework decoration has been completed,to preserve local history..
